item.description:
Join Members and Guests of the SSDOMG for a rare Saturday Night Dinner!  Johnny Macaroni's in East Bridgewater is located on Route 106 just a couple miles from Route 24 and a few miles from Route 18.  They are what we can consider an "inexpensive" restaurant where just about everything on the menu is under $20, with more than half of their menu items under $15 (including entrees).  This is great for the budget-conscious who want to dine out affordably.  Please feel free to bring a friend and join us for a Saturday Night Dinner in the heart of the South Shore!

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Saturday Night Dinner!

Saturday, September 10th @ 6pm

582 West Street

East Bridgewater, MA 02333 

508-378-9335

www.johnnymacaronis.com

Meeting Place: Please meet outside the front door. We may have to wait a few minutes to be seated.  Meet us at our table after we are seated.  The reservation is under "Angela."

Please Note:

1. We may be separated into two tables.

2. They can accomodate a party in excess of 10 people but we need to be there by 6pm to avoid a wait.

3. If anyone wants to carpool from Braintree please post in the Talk About it Section.  If there is enough interest by Mon 9/5 I will post a carpool.  

Organizers: Angela

Event Fee: [Current] Annual Members & 1 Guest - FREE, Members - $2 each; Guests - $2 each; $6 to become a 2011 Annual Member  (One of your last chances to do so as 9/30 is the last date you can become a 2011 AM.) 

Min/Max: No minimum as Angela and her Guests will dine just themselves if no one else joins us.

Guests: Up to 2 per member.

RSVP Deadline: NOON on Saturday, September 10th. Any changes made after this time may not be seen by an Event Organizer prior to the event.

Please bring cash. You are responsible for your portion of the bill including drinks, food, shared food, tax, and tip.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Directions: Courtesy of one of Angela's Guests, Ann.  To be updated Labor Day weekend as there is a typo that I have to find.

Overview: Located on Route 106 near Routes 18 and 24.

From Route 24: Take the exit for Route 106 East. Stay straight and follow Rt 106 through several sets of lights. At one point the road will come to a set of lights with a left and right turn and a fork  if you go straight with a strip mall with AT&T directly in front of you. go straight and bear left, keeping AT&T to your right (stay in left lane for this, there will be a green arrow).  You will pass Trucchi's grocery store on your left. Continue straight for another few minutes, passing a small plaza w/Sandy Rose Cafe, antiques store and convenience store on your right. Johnny Macaroni's less than a mile after this on your right. As you cross the railroad tracks you will see a black silouhette sign with a figure pointing to parking (in back) for the restaurant.

From Route 18 Southbound:  Take Rt 18 through Abington and  Whitman into East Bridgewater. After passing Joppa Dance Studio and Viking Bowling, bear right at set of lights onto Rt 106 West. Follow for about 1 mile until you reach Johnny Macaroni's on your left (you will see a small car dealership on your right).  

From Route 18 Northbound:  Take Rt 18 through Middleboro, and Bridgewater until you reach East Bridgewater. At the set of lights at Elmwood Antiques (aka Diana's Whatnot Shop) take a left onto Rt 106 West.  Follow for about 1 mile until you reach Johnny Macaroni's on your left (you will see a small car dealership on your right).
item.how_to_find_us: Meet outside the front door or at our table after we are seated. Reservation is under "Angela."

group.name: The South Shore Dining Out Meetup Group

item.name: Saturday Night Dinner!
